intro: Creochiton superba, commonly known as the superba forest snail, is a species of air-breathing land snail. It belongs to the family Achatinidae and is native to tropical regions of Africa. The snail has a glossy, spiral-shaped shell that is typically brown or dark green in color. Its body is soft and covered with a mucus-like layer that helps it retain moisture. Creochiton superba plays a role in its ecosystem by contributing to nutrient cycling through its feeding habits.
